title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Very lengthy! Staff was fine, but felt like they kept adding on random interviews though in the end the hiring manager mentioned they never had a an intention of hiring me; they just wanted to keep me connected until they found a better fit.
Interview Questions: Why WashU? What about this job interests you?

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Had one on campus interview with a student. It was very casual and low stakes. It seemed like it was just to gauge interest and to see if I had interest in organizations on campus.
Interview Questions: Casual conversation about school aspirations.

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: They want to see how comfortable you would be with in-person student-led campus tours and how enthusiastic you are for the school. I talked about positive experiences with the school places that I hung out on campus to study, eat, and catch up with friends.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in becoming an ambassador

title: Security Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by the hiring manager and asked to set up a video call. Everything was handled via Zoom with 2-3 people participating in each call. Everyone was polite and it was an enjoyable process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join this organization?

title: Test Proctor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward behavioral interview. Why do you want to work there and what value do you bring? Just have a conversation and be excited to join. Interview less than thirty minutes
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work there and what value do you bring?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and after a few weeks was asked to do a phone interview with hiring manager. It went well but I never a response to my application weeks later - I had to find out that I had not been selected when I checked my account on the online job portal. Not cool.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for the job

title: Prospect Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: She scheduled a 30 minute phone screen. She told me about the position, asked about my experience, and allowed time for questions. I did not make it beyond this round because I did not have the required skills.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your prospect research experience.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Creve Coeur, MO)
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a phone interview a few days after I applied for the position. I explained to the representative that I was at work and I was still asked “can we do a phone interview”. The representative told me to ask for her when I came to the in-person interview. I got past the phone interview and was interviewed in person. When I got to the interview nobody knew what representative I was referring too. I didn’t even know who was interviewing me until a few minutes before the interview! Awful first impression! I was not offered the position due to unknown reasons. I wasn’t called and found out via portal! Waste of time, effort, and energy. Not to mention the PTO I had to take in order to interview.
Interview Questions: Give a strength and weakness Give a an example of a co-worker you would not want to work with?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: I met with other faculty and staff members. I was introduced to the role and the university med center campus. Opportunity to return for a second visit. Met with HR for benefits.
Interview Questions: I was asked about past experience .

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds of interviews, and the process lasted just over a month. First round was 30 minutes, in the second I gave a presentation on my dissertation research.
Interview Questions: They asked about my dissertation research and how I would incorporate that research in the classroom.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: There is a video interview including six short questions, which give you about forty five seconds to prepare and about one minute to answer. There is also one writing assignment which need to be done in five minutes.
Interview Questions: How does this program fit you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, but directions were hard because of complicated medical campus and parking. Overall, supervisor helpful in finding area for the interview. There were 2 rounds of interviews, the first being a zoom call of course.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Florissant, MO) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted about a week or so after applying online. First had a phone interview. A few days later they emailed me to come to the office as one of 3 finalists. I met the team, and got a tour. I thought it went great! But have not heard back in a week.
Interview Questions: Where would you like to be in 5 years?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: honestly there wasn't any interview, just that we had to get in touch with the professor on the regular bases and update him about our progress. Also it is a very easy process
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, how do you see yourself after 5 years

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: why choose Washington University in St.Louis, self introduction, do you have any group work experience, why do you choose finance major? Do you have any leadership experience? Talk me a little bit more about your last internship.
Interview Questions: why choose Washington University in St.Louis, self introduction, do you have any group work experience, why do you choose finance major? Do you have any leadership experience? Talk me a little bit more about your last internship.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: You interview with a professor you are working with. And they go through required skills and research topics you will work on. The required skills depend on the department and mostly statistics and communication skills are evaluated.
Interview Questions: They will ask about your skills. In my case, I worked with a professor at the Olin School doing quantitative analyses so proficiency in Stata was required. Also I had a interview during which the professor went through overall job task and a research topic he had been working on.

title: IT Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Outstanding interview process. Hiring manager started off the process with a one on one discussion. Panel interview was with six people all actively engaged and asking position appropriate questions. The follow up conversation was just the same, targeted, specific to the job.
Interview Questions: Best question. Tell me about a job that you have accepted that you knew was not a good fit from day one.

title: Full Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was one full day of rotating panels followed by one half day meeting with the Dean. The interviewee provided a brief presentation on vision and/or teaching philosophy. There were several inter-department meetings, including meetings with IT and business and budget personnel.
Interview Questions: My vision of the direction of the program.

title: Advancement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: My interview went well, however, the process from initial contact to a decision lasted seven months and once a decision was made, I didn't receive so much as an automated notification regarding my status. Instead, I found out that I had not been selected when I checked my account on the online job portal. Although this isn't terribly uncommon, it's still a disappointing practice, especially after such a long process.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were pretty standard; overall, I enjoyed the interview

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Sending my resume to the professor, professor will check my background and resume to decide whether I am qualified. If I am qualified, then HR department will contact me, and I need to make a reservation with them to fill out some official documents.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to apply for this position?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: The people I spoke were very welcoming and relaxed. I was not asked difficult questions and instead just wanted to get to know me. There is little preparation required to be successful except knowing your motivation to be at the institution.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a project that did not work and how you overcame the issues

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: 1st interview was a zoom interview. Felt more like a discussion. 2nd interview was a meeting with the whole team. Scheduled as one-on-ones. Overall the process was very smooth and comfortable.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for this lab?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a 1-3 minute presentation on any topic followed by questions. The second was a 5-10 minutes presentation for a bigger group also followed by questions on the presentation and then interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Regional Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: The process occured from October 2021 to January 2022. It took a bit longer than usual due to the holiday season. Part of the interviews were via Zoom and they had me come to the building for one of the last ones.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Washu?

title: Career Center Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed first with HR who screened for salary requirement and basic job qualifications. This was by phone. Second round was in person interview with director of career services and other advisors.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why are you interested in this role.

title: Manager of Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Went through several rounds of speaking with many different doctors and professionals within the department. Some of them were repeat interviews with individuals that would have been either direct counterparts or coworkers.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with difficult people below?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Very little conversation or engagement during interview, felt like I was putting them out just by being there, and no follow up of decision (had to reach out just to get a response)
Interview Questions:
What are you applying?
Do you have any questions?

That’s it.

title: Alumni and Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very long. Took several weeks, and had to meet with up to 14-15 different people. It is a very tedious bureaucratic process. It is not a deal breaker, but it is a lot to go through for a position that isn't even at the very highest level.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Grants Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process started with a fifteen minute screening Zoom call, followed by more in depth interviews with directors and assistant deans of research. Scheduling interviews moved quickly, within two weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Washington University?

title: Statistical Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds. One with immediate supervisor and the other with department lead. Was asked to explain a project I worked on,  2-3 statistical questions and comfort level of programming in SAS and R.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Major Gifts Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is long and you meet with several individuals. The conduct an initial interview via zoom. If that goes well, they ask to interview in person. Some didn't have much say in the hiring. It really should only be the upper management who is a part of the hiring process.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this job?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: I had a screening phone call with my future manager. It was more geared towards telling me about the position than an actual interview. Next, she sent up a group interview with principal investigators.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: You have to apply the job before the class opening and communicate with your profession to apply for the job. If everything goes well, you can be a teaching assistant.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to apply for the interview?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Friendly environment, good interaction with different people of the team, did not have any challenging questions. They also offer convenient setting, which is zoom, so we can choose the flexible time to arrange the interview appointment.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
What would you avoid when analyzing the data?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Online interview about why the candidate wants to work as a TA, basically a zoom meeting with the coordinator, which lasted about 20 - 30 minutes. The interview was casual.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to be a TA?
What methods would you use as a TA to enhance understanding?

title: Contract Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was over zoom, during work hours, and all three people who are in charge of the department were involved. Overall it was a good interview but the problem is that I never heard anything back from them despite two follow ups. Radio silence
Interview Questions: If I had ever had any interactions with doctors

title: Imaging Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward process. There were questions about the resume. Just be sure to know your resume well. Wasn't many technical questions but never a bad idea to prepare for it.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to get into research?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Group interviews.  Behavioral interviews.  Lots of what if questions with deep dives and additional questions. Good discussions. Helped me know the group and culture. Two large groups with all areas represented.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time…

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewing with multiple interviewers by using zoom.
Starting with introducing yourself. Telling about my research and the area that I am interested in. Asking some questions about the lab, group, and position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was very long, and unfruitful. I did virtual interviews, and was given promising feedback and additional interviews, but at the end of the process the salary was unacceptable and that was disappointing
Interview Questions: Why am I interested in the position?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: It was nice. Some technical questions. Mostly from CV. It was 2 hours interview presenting my thesis. You need to present a power point presentation . I hope that can help others
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do postdoc

title: Urban Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was conducted by the Vice President of the department, Senior Urban Designer, and HR.
It was a very smooth 30 min interview with their introduction followed by mine.
Interview Questions:
1. Why this role and this organization?
2. What expertise can you bring to the table?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted shortly after submitting my application. I was interviewed by two people via Zoom. They were very friendly and very informative. They were easy to talk to. They seemed a little annoyed with one of the questions I asked them.
Interview Questions: What is the hardest patient for you to see?

title: Residential Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (America, AL)
Interview Descriptions: Application first, then interview, and notification two weeks later. The interview had two interviewers, one current Residential Advisor ( a student) and a Residential College Director (a staff member). They alternated with asking questions. They let me collect my thoughts before answering every question and were very considerate and willing to clarify questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an RA?

title: Staff Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very cordial. Asked to explain my previous work and how I will fit into the new team. I had prepared a presentation and was allowed to do that.
Interview Questions: Explain previous work related to the position.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: It was standard. Nothing too crazy. Be prepared to discuss science and know your background. It is dependent on the position you are applying for. Research the group you are interviewing with.
Interview Questions: How do you handle things when they go wrong

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was simple. I had a 30 min interview via zoom with a more technical team, a 30 min interview via zoom with the person that would be my direct supervisor, and a follow-up interview on campus with leadership.
Interview Questions: What was something about the job description that attracted you to apply to this position?

title: Admin Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a little lengthy, but standard. Had two rounds of interviews with different people each time before being offered the position. All interviews were conducted via zoom with lots of flexibility on time.
Interview Questions: How do you feel you are prepared to contribute to our DE&I mission?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Approachable interview about research and teaching. A lot of questions about future project and publication plans for two years. Also, expect questions about teaching philosophy and approaches. It is best to have some key examples in mind.
Interview Questions: What major research project are you working on?

title: Office of Education Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was an incredible waste of time. They were not at all respectful of my time, as they made me sit through four different interviews with every single person on a fairly large team. The interviews were pointless and ineffective, as each person was clearly tasked with making up their own questions and it was obvious some just didn't care. A few of the team members even complained about it during the interview, as they had better things to do than sit through yet another candidate interview. I advise you to try to be cognizant of other people's time. You're not that important.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you (insert random behavioral question here).

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions about why I was interested. Main way to get an interview is to reach out to the professor directly and express genuine interest. After that, it's more about whether you connect well with the professor.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a research assistant?

title: Insurance Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Simple  and easy.  Not too many questions and were simple. Just stay calm and focus on  the common goal and agenda. Nice people and company is great and comfortable  just do well and keep up the good work
Interview Questions: What are your goals and dreams

title: MCAT PSG Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward interview, just asked "why do you want to be a PSG leader?" and "what experiences do you have for this position?" Then asked what are the available time periods for acting as a PSG leader and what session I would be willing to run.
Interview Questions:
"why do you want to be a PSG leader?" 
"what experiences do you have for this position?" 
Then asked what are the available time periods for acting as a PSG leader and what session I would be willing to run.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an initial phone screening, then proceeded with two interviews: one team/behavioral and the other technical. I received a request for each next interview within 24 hours of completing the one previous. I received no follow up after I was told they would be checking my references before taking next steps in the hiring process. While the interviews themselves went great, I would've appreciate notice that I did not get the job as well as some feedback.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your preferred management style.

title: Master Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Online virtual interview and it was pre-recorded. You are given some questions and required to answer and there is also a time limit for you to complete. Several questions are related to your life and how you respond in certain situations.
Interview Questions: What is the most challenging thing you have faced throughout your academic journey.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: I sent a letter to a lab I was interested in. They asked for my resume and then we had a brief Skype call where I was asked about my interest in the position
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Assistant Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Lake St Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly streamlined. Applied online, took a personality assessment (which was unnecessary), phone screen, Skype interview with a presentation (I was out of state but usually an in person). In person IV had about 10 people in it which is 7 too many.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time when you acted hastily and had to deal with the consequences?

title: Bioinformatics Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview started with job role description and then some questions on my project experience. The interview was technical and all the questions were intriguing as well as thought-provoking.
Interview Questions: Asked about git usage, my project experience

title: Ph.D. Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Friendly environment; briefly talked about research experiences, future research plans, and funding resources. One vs. one talk with several professors of interests, with each one lasted for 30 minutes. Got to talk to the current grad student as well, which is really helpful.
Interview Questions: Describe your past research experience on your CV

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: No specific advice, just basic questions about the experience (internship or on class project would be fine). It would be better related to data analysis, not a big deal if not. Not that hard.
Interview Questions: Your past experience in data analysis

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Almost non-existent, was just asked about my availability. I met with the department head and we just chatted about what would be expected of me for this position. It was very low key and not a big deal at all.
Interview Questions: How are your time management skills

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Traditional interview questions. A couple of situational questions thrown in, last about 30 minutes.  Three interviewers present, two hiring managers and HR.  Interview was relatively easy they asked about production and setting goals.
Interview Questions: What frustrates you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: one phone interview and then offer afterward. Applied online after searching university website. Asked for writing sample/ statement of interest. The call lasted about 45min and was with the program manager of the center I would be working with.
Interview Questions: tell us about your interest in xyz subject matter

title: Custodian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Had nothing to ask just talked about random things and I didnt like that it took so long to even get an interview but I still got the job. Turned out good
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Very slow process but the interviewers were kind and responsive . The company is worth the long process and I am happy I stuck it out. The interviewers had a lot of information and were good at being specific instead of just selling the job or university. It was very transparent.
Interview Questions: How do you handle tech changes?

title: Social Science Data Curator & GIS Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
It followed the standard interview format for an academic job. A casual, informal "meet & greet" dinner the night before with the search committee at a nice local restaurant followed by a full 8-hour day of interviews with various committees, panels, and academic departments. A 20-30 minute presentation in the mid-morning with a question and answer session. 

At the end of the day, the search committee chair walked me out of the building and told me that I would hear something back in 3 to 4 weeks. I heard nothing, absolutely nothing, back for 9 weeks until I received an automated rejection email. My emails to the search committee chair were never responded to and my request for travel reimbursement (an exercise that was both promised during the interview process and is traditional when invited to an on-campus interview) was ignored.
Interview Questions:
What about your academic and professional experience makes you a good fit for this role? Tell us about data curation policies you have in your current place of employment? 

Half of the questions were general in nature and the other half of the questions were focused on data curation standards, your experience with data curation, library/research experience, etc.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: One round interview with several faculty. Behavioral questions most time such as why our school, why this major, what's the motivation. And also some technical questions such as your research area, what's your favorite paper and comment on some famous papers
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process involved a phone screening interview and an in-person interview with the team. The phone interview lasted about thirty minutes and the in-person interview lasted a little over an hour.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Mid-Level Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview, in person meetings - interviews with a number of panels.   Presentation.  Skill level assessment exam.  Lunch alone in a room.  Nobody came to eat with me.  It was eerie.  Never experienced something like that.
Interview Questions: One panel was rude, cold and deliberately unfriendly.  The clearly meant to drive me away.  The department head disappeared  at the halfway point and at the end of my last meeting the panel left me sitting in a big meeting room alone.  There was no adios or anything.  No wrap-up.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: After a brief phone screen, there was an in-person interview. The interview involved multiple in-person discussions on a single day, but the tone was fairly light and friendly. It was pretty straightforward.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous experience working at [blank].

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: There are two professors attending the interview. I presented my work in Powerpoints slides. It was a pretty easy job, and then there were a few questions following that.
Interview Questions: Why you used such devices in your previous experiments?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of phone interview. Asking basic skill set and personal information toward the position. The time can be scheduled upon your convenience, and the conversation experience was  pretty good.
Interview Questions: Previous job experiences and behavioral questions

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Preliminary phone interview,  in-person interview with staff, in-person interview with manager. The most time was spent with the in-person interview with staff, including laboratory tour. Interview with manager was primarily personality question based
Interview Questions: How do you work independently and with others?

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: I e-mailed the PI my cover letter and resume. After no reply, I met her in person by going to her lab and waiting for her to leave. I asked her if she saw my previous e-mail, and she said she had meant to get back to me. I asked for the position and got the position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Great got a call from hiring manager and same day schedule interview and following week for job offer. Interview was very easy going and I felt comfortable. Very professional setting
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why would you be a right fit

title: Design Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Super easy and casual. Sat in her office. She asked me some questions, no big deal at all. I think she was only considering two candidates... And I was an obvious favorite, if I remember correctly she even told me this during the interview?
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: Secretary III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in June and was contacted one month later to schedule an interview. I met and communicated with division administrator who seemed very interested in my background and me. She reiterated throughout the interview that I was a quality candidate and made positive comments about my test scores. She said that she would contact me at the beginning of the next week to schedule a second interview and then never reached out again. Personally, I find it to be really unprofessional when someone says they'll reach out and then doesn't.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time in which you had to take on a leadership role

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: interview process was clearly explained. Contact person was very thorough throughout the entire process. When I had questions prior to interview, i could always reach out for help r assistance.
Interview Questions: How well are you under pressure

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Interview very relaxed. Most managers tell you about the position and explain the expectations. They usually do not ask too many questions, but ask if you have any questions about the position. After the interview, I did have an email and have to have 5 people fill out a reference survey. For some interviews I had an interview with the manager and then a panel interview with the team. Another interview it was just with 1 manager and the other time it was with 3 different managers but all 1:1.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Residential Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Online application with personal information and a few short essay questions about experience and interest in the position.   This is followed by a group process with 4 different activities and a 45-minute long individual interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you advocated for someone else.

title: Research Assistant OBGYN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with four women and got asked a variety of normal interview questions. I just had one interview and then got an offer.  Overall not a bad experience. Was one of my first interviews.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you went above and beyond in a workplace situation.

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with the PI to discuss job responsibilities, ongoing and future research projects. Overall, very low stress interview and had more of a conversation rather than a traditional interview Q&A session
Interview Questions: What are you hoping to get out of this experience?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied for mechanical engineering (around 15th of Jan), and I received an email for the campus visit around Feb-15. It was standard campus visit (seeing different labs and I was interviewed by five different professors).
Interview Questions: simple questions like tell us more about your background and what you did until now. After this, they talked about their research.

title: Medical Records Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, initial phone interview asking to describe what I did in previous position and gauging my interest in clerk job, in-person, one-on-one interview with immediate supervisor with pre-determined questions asked of all applicants, same-day telephone interview with manager because I expressed a strong interest but also had another pending job offer, next day reference check with most recent supervisor and call to confirm I was the lead candidate, reference email sent to other references (over the weekend), offer letter received following Tuesday
Interview Questions: How do you manage having your work interrupted?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Phila, PA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: If you weren't asking the questions the way he wanted he rephrased them to get the answer you were looking for.  Very blunt and to the point. He was funny but didn't waste any time letting me know I wasn't moving forward in the search.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you made a mistake at work

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with PI and lab manager to discuss the project at hand. Described my background. Reviewed the research study's timeline and the responsibilities that will be asked of the research assistants involved. Answered a series of the PI's questions about my research interests and future plans.
Interview Questions: Describe your prior research experience, including skills you acquired.

title: Statistical Data Analyst/Programmer - Infectious Diseases Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was a  pleasant interview. The PI, together with several staff, gave me a phone interview on time. The interview began with introduction to the job responsibilities and work environment, and then they asked me about my previous research experience in Washington University School of Medicine. They emphasized  that this job focused more on data management than analysis, and I was asked to talk about the data managments tasks I worked on in my internship. At last, they gave me the chance to ask questions about them, and provided responsible answers.
Interview Questions: Are you more interested in statistics or programming?

title: JD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Nashville, TN) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process is very numbers driven. That being said, they don't want to extend offers and scholarships to people that are just going to use them to negotiate a better offer elsewhere. Be excited about St. Louis and WULS.
Interview Questions: They asked me why I wanted to be in St. Louis.

title: Reporting Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: One face to face interview asking about my work experience and testing my personality and if I am a right fit for the job. Very general questions without much detail to the technical skills
Interview Questions: Normal and experience

title: Senior Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a very easy interview - first there was a computer test and then a face to face interview. The face to face interview was with 2 people and it last about an hour.
Interview Questions: They asked typical interview questions, nothing difficult.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Ask your research experience. Including the software you used and how your analysis the data. How to recruit patient. How to solve the problem. How good is your data analysis skills?
Interview Questions: Ask your research experience.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a telephone interview with a panel of 7 members and lasted about 30 minute. Members of the panel were all from different areas - some would be team members and others were from a different area of the college.
Interview Questions: What ideas do you have to improve this department?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Hiring Physicians go through HR for prescreening and scheduling.  Once interviewed, it took at least two weeks to hear back a yes or no. This was done through HR as well, with your listed preferred method of communication. The interview style is based entirely on who is interviewing though. MDs do not have to follow a preset list of questions.
Interview Questions: I loved how the physician said right off the bat, lets act like this is a dating interview. The person who I hire will have a strong relationship with me and I want to make sure we are compatible. She completely through out the standard questions. Very relaxed and professional at the same time

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was essentially reaching out via email to whichever lab you want to work at at, then a phone call with the P.I. and finally a in person interview. It feels more like a chat than anything.
Interview Questions: What were your prior research interests?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: After sending emails to the professor I hope to work with, I scheduled a short meeting with him. We talked about courses I took, the grade I got, and some relevant experience I had and so on.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with Matlab?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed by a physician for a phone interview three days after I applied online. Had the phone interview two days later after being contacted. Set up an in person interview on the phone at the end of the phone interview for the following week.
Interview Questions: What are you expecting in this position?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Laid-back, conversational interview which took place on the WashU medical school campus. This interview, just like the few others I've had, was fairly non-threatening and easy going. However, this particular interviewer asked me a few questions that I was ill-prepared for (questions regarding statistical analyses, etc.). In my experience, all of the interviewers were quite friendly, but I would be wary about those that don't at least grill you slightly on specific attributes about working in their lab, because they are most likely not as serious about the interview as you are.
Interview Questions: Describe in detail your previous research experience

title: Maintenance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Long and stretched out over many months.  They will have you to come in on multiple occasions to meet with different people and groups.  It is a pretty lengthy process.
Interview Questions: Asked about knowledge of different trades with specific instances

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a Skype interview first. Then the PI asked me recommendation letters and offered an on-site interview. I gave a presentation about my graduate research to the department, talked with every member in the lab. They introduced their own projects for me. And talked with the PI for potential projects for postdoc
Interview Questions: What are important factors for successful scientist

title: Residential Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a written application including basic information and written essays followed by a series of group interviews (discussions and exercise). The interview process concluded with an individual interview with active RA's and a residential college director.
Interview Questions: A series of behavioral type questions mixed with job specific questions (why this job, what does community look like, etc).

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with 20 people over the course of 2 hours or so.  I thought this was odd for a middle manager position at my pay level.
Interview Questions: I can't remember most of the specific questions.  They were largely behavioral type questions.

title: Post Doctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: It varies from lab to lab. In my lab, generally the candidate meets with PI and other persons one on one. He presents his work to group. Meets with some collaborators. The questions are blend of science and general non-science questions.
Interview Questions: How would you solve a very specific problem, which the lab was facing from a year.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly straight forward, and just questions about how I would plan events, would I like working in an office, etc.  I think they were worried I might not like working in an office.
Interview Questions: Can you give examples of how you've been able to network?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Three group interviews.  All were fit questions such as what in your work experience prepared you for this role and what challenges do you think you would face in the job
Interview Questions: Challenges you see in the job

title: Certified Medical Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview STAR method very comfortable environment, manager made the experience easy as if I were talking to a friend. I transferred to this position internally as I have already been with this company for 6 years.
Interview Questions:
Describe how youTell me about the most complicated message you have had to communicate to someone on the
job. How was it complicated? What did you do to ensure that the message was understood?
How successful were you in communicating what you intended?

title: Level I Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a one-round interview process with 2 full time staff members. They asked few technical questions, and mostly wanted to know how many other current techs that I knew. They definitely value having a close-knitted team that feels comfortable working with one another. They want you to be fairly comfortable with mac computers as well.
Interview Questions: What's your experience with mac computers?

title: Grant Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from a recruiter asking how I felt about working in grants. I accepted to come in for an interview. I was screened by the research administrator as well as the division head.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this job.

title: Note Maker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: They are very friendly. Salary is due to how many copies do you have. They  have some requirements for your minimum grades. Absolutely, the higher, the better. And the notes have to be taken nearly so that they can of real help.
Interview Questions: Such like how many hours can you be here for a week

title: Scientisr Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Took a lengthy interview as if they were giving me a faculty position. It was same as a faculty interview with 1/3rd of the salary . 
Took 5 hours for the interview and was promised things verbally which were not delivered after joining
Interview Questions: Why do you want to change labs?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews. Both were relatively casual. The interviews were conducted like conversations mostly. The interview would start with a question, but instead of just moving on, there was some back and forth. In both interviews, the interviewer spent some time explaining details about the job, so the interviews felt like a two-way street instead of just the interviewee listening and answering questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a conflict with your supervisor. What was the issue and how did you resolve it?

title: Director of Clinical Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Thorough interview process, itinerary consisted of multi levels of faculty and staff. This gave a multi layer impression of the culture and work environment. The process was lengthy consisting of intense screening process.
Interview Questions: With your minimal view of the organization, what process improvements would you suggest in the future.

title: Senior Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Somewhat informal interview filled with garbage questions taken straight off an HR "What to ask your interview candidate" site.  Didn't ask questions about my skills, didn't describe job, didn't ask if I had questions.  I haven't yet heard back if I got the job, but I don't imagine that I did.
Interview Questions: How do you manage stress?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview, submitted a writing sample and summary of interests and experiences that were reviewed during the interview. It lasted about 45 min and was with the program manager. There were no trick questions are anything irregular about the process.
Interview Questions: tell us about your experience with multiple projects and co occurring deadlines

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Imperial, MO) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty quick and easy! I applied and about a week later I received an email for an interview. I went in the next day for an interview and then was contacted for a second interview a few days later. The day after the second interview I was asked if my references could be contacted and then I received an offer a few days later. Start to finish the interview process lasted about 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: The questions were much related to my current job and other questions about my personally, such as my schooling and hobbies. They really wanted to get to know me personally and see how I fit into their organization.

title: Research Lab/Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Very informal interview process due to networking opportunity; Best suggestion for wanting a position at this institution is for you to network with key grant holders. The traditional methods of applying for a job here is very slim.  Its better to network with someone already established at the institution rather going through the traditional method.
Interview Questions: Q: What are your future plans in research?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Called in to interview. Within and hour after my interview, I was called back for the second. then offered the job. They tend to move slow but this showed that if they want you they can move faster.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: They seemed to just give me the job. However, then there wasn't enough work for me. The post-doc and graduate student who interviewed me were very nice. I didn't feel nervous. I just came into the office and they asked me to talk about myself. There was nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this lab? Talk about prior experiences.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Application through HR, phone interview with HR, many panel interviews. Over a 4 hour long interview, I was asked the exact same questions from a prepared sheet over and over. That was frustrating, but by hour 4 (and interviewer 10?) I had basically perfected every answer. Everyone was very kind, though, and I felt very at ease.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were unable to accomplish your task within a deadline.

title: Danforth University Center Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very typical interview process with typical questions asked. A good job to apply for and one of the best campus jobs, so practice beforehand and be yourself! They are looking for a diverse representation of the WashU student community to staff the university center, so being authentic is the best you can do for this interview. Even if you stumble through some questions, it's ok. Most of the candidates are interviewing for a job for the first time.
Interview Questions: What excited you about the job description and made you want to apply?

title: Police Dispatcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very fast and professional process. I applied and about a week later I had a phone call from HR to set up an interview. I interviewed with a four person panel. I then got a call from HR a few days later to set up a second interview with the same format. I then received a call a few days later with a job offer
Interview Questions: Pretend you are a radio broadcaster and do a short 30 second commercial on why we should hire you. Sell youself to us.

title: Senior Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The first step was a phone screening in which the Project Coordinator seemed as though she was going through a checklist of qualifications and skills to see if I was a match. The second interview required me to meet with the Project Coordinator and Evaluation Lead to discuss the same qualifications and skills. There weren't too many "tell me about a time when..." questions, even though I was prepared to answer them. I tried to incorporate them into my answers, though.
Interview Questions: Can you describe your experience with customer service?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviews are done with PIs from various disciplines. The interviews are not challenging. They process seems to be done to ensure that the person will be a good student and scientist.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to attend WashU for graduate school?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with Research Manager and two Research Coordinators for panel interview.  Interview lasted about an hour.  Second Interview I met with Research Manager. “What If” situation questions and lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: You reply to one of their adds then they will meet with you for a face to face interview. The mock interviews are semi formal and if you get the job, you get a lot of free food.
Interview Questions: You go through mock calling scenarios

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a hiring manager about the research assistant job in an engineering lab. Had a casual chat with the PI about past research and lab experiences. The staff were all very friendly and willing to give me directions and help.
Interview Questions: What was your research experience

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: I sent in an online application detailing the reasons why I was interested in getting the job for being a math tutor. They then emailed me saying i'd moved through and should get some recommendations from teachers. I did this and a few weeks later i got the job. It was a very simple and easy process. They just need to find a way to get more people to apply
Interview Questions: just the application

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. After attending graduate school, you had 1 year of rotation work to select which lab to work for.  Hence, while selecting the labs the PI did interview you to see if you were the best match for the lab.
Interview Questions: What sort of graduate work, you are interested in?

title: Contracts Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed by hiring manager to schedule interview. Agreed to the time she suggested. Did not hear anything more from them confirming interview. Actual interview was pleasant enough, although it was a "gang" interview. Sent a follow-up email the next day. Never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job, other than for the income?

title: PLTL Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: I had a very brief interview with the program coordinator and current PLTL leaders. They asked me questions on how to handle certain group scenarios, what I gained from the program, situations where being in a group helped, or I learned something valuable from working in a group environment etc and also asked what questions I had.
Interview Questions: What are pros and cons to dominant and quiet students in a group?

title: Mental Health Counseling Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with Director of Counseling and a Psychiatrist on staff for a face to face interview. The two took turns asking me what seemed like undergraduate school questions about how to counsel.
Interview Questions: Tell us how you use CBT with Trauma clients?

title: Grant Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was simple, informal, and informative. The interview lasted about 20 minutes and seemed promising but i guess they got a better applicant. However, interviewer was not strong and seemed to not understand the job she was hiring for.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with the person currently in the position, and team interview with the doctors who would be my supervisors. The entire process lasted a little over an hour. The initial interview was a phone screen that lasted around 30-45 minutes, both myself and the person interviewing me asked questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me your IRB experience

title: Student Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received an unplanned phone call almost two weeks after I had applied for the position online. It very casual, asked typical questions and your knowledge about being a student fundraiser. The phone call was very spotty so it was hard to hear what they were saying. The phone call lasted a total of 8 minutes, and they followed up 2 to 3 weeks after the phone call interview.
Interview Questions: What do you know about being a student fundraiser?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Filled out a million job applications to the site. Received email from prospective PI/Labs. One was initially a phone interview (PI in Columbia NY), then in person interview with fellow WashU colleague , followed by another phone interview with post docs, and ended with a final phone interview. Had to email to get final outcome since I hadn't heard from them and had another job offer that I needed to reply to. Then I was informed by email that i did not get the position. Would have been nice if I was informed sooner, rather than 2 weeks later. My second position process was much smoother, but unique. Was first contacted through email to set up a time to come in and perform a lab "test" both in person and through a take home "quiz". The same day I arranged to take the lab portion, had interview with PI and senior PhD student. Overall 4 hour time frame. Completed the take home portion and turned in next day via email. Was emailed to set up phone interview time. At that point was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were very standard.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position online and was called back for an interview after about 3 weeks. The interview took place in a conference room and was with just one person, which was not what I was expecting. I was asked about my relevant experience and my background, then the position and research was described to me in detail. Overall the interview lasted about 35 minutes. The interviewer was very friendly and made me feel very comfortable.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in clinical research? Why do you think you would be good at this position?

title: PSR II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very informative about the role. Asked the usual questions about you personally and professionally. Reviewed my resume, collected back ground information. Talked about the benefits of the University and expectations.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online through a work-study portal (as part of my financial aid package allowed for me to find a work study job) and after rating multiple departments as those I would like to work in, was contacted by my second choice.  I had somewhat of an email interview and then an informal meet-and-greet once I arrived in St. Louis
Interview Questions: What interests you about our department?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Both of the interviewers were friendly and cordial throughout the interview, asking questions about my experience, involvement on campus as a student, and why I was interested in the admissions officer position. As part of the interview, they required I prepare and then present for three-to-five minutes on any topic of my choosing. They were prompt in sending status emails and responding to queries. Thought everything went well and they told me to let them know if I got any competing offers, but I must not have been a good fit for the position because they did not choose to invite me for a second interview.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you worked on a team and how you managed conflict.

title: IBC II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It takes a long time to get interviewed. Phone interview, and then one interview. Competition is tough and HR has process to be hired. Some of the interview part is email.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Washington University? How is your experience related to the job?

title: Library Circulation Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: As the job does not require much skills,  the interview was very conversational. They were mainly looking for people who would like to work hard and potentially work for a long period time. So if you are thinking about working at the library try to apply when you are freshman or sophomore.
Interview Questions: Asked me if I have relevant experience.

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: I applied many months prior to being called for an interview. I met with the Office Manager for the Department I applied with. She was very open to the hours to meeting me as I had another position. Once the interview was over and a few days went by, I received a phone call from her offering me the position. She was concerned about the starting pay as I had a sick child, but new that I was a right fit for her department.
Interview Questions: Describe how I would handle a disgruntled patient.

title: Senior Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted for an hour.  The interviewing process  generally went on smoothly with the emloyer. The interviewer was serious but vey reasonable. A lot of details of job related  skills were asked.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience.

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: There was only an online form to fill out with a variety of questions mostly about why you want to be a TA and also a couple of situational questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a TA?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received an email invitation to meet with a hiring manager. Met with the hiring manager within a week for a 1-1 interview. Unfortunately, I didn't get the offer and was notified via email within a week.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your experiences

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with a lady in Cincinnati, who then referred me to the assistant of the surgeon for whom I would be working. I then set up an interview directly with the surgeon who was hiring. He asked me about my experience and interest level in writing papers, among other things.
Interview Questions: What is your interest in the medical field?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the university's job website. The professor contacted me to set up an in-person interview the following week. The interview lasted about 2 hours, and it was mostly about how my skill sets and experience would fit into the lab and what my future goals are. A week later, I got an offer letter stating my start date and salary. Reference checks and background checks are part of the hiring process. Drug test varies with different positions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis
Interview Descriptions: Emailed and spoke to professors and discussed some projects that I worked on in the past. Explained who I was to the professor in terms of hobbies and interests. They gave me ideas of what their labs do and what I would do in their labs.
Interview Questions: What are some of your past experiences in research? What do you do?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was brought in for a very informal interview. It was not until the end of the three or so hour "tour" that I realized it was intended to be an interview. A large aspect of the process seemed to be assessing my ability to get along with the other members of the lab.
Interview Questions: Less of a formal Q & A. By walking me through a variety of projects, they were trying to see whether or not I understand how and why things worked the way they did.

title: Communications Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Washington University in St. Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy, multiple-interview process over several weeks, even months! Met first with some kind of admin assistant. Second interview was a 4-person panel. Third interview was finally with the director and hiring manager. Called for a large time investment on applicant's part.
